dcterms:creator: Piero Bonissone
Soumitra Dutta
dcterms:description: MARS is a mergers & acquisitions reasoning system that integrates case-based reasoning (CBR) and rule-based reasoning (RBR) to provide expert advice in the financial domain of mergers and acquisitions.
dcterms:title: MARS

dcterms:creator: A. Michel
I. Shaked
dcterms:description: The Mobil-Marathon case illustrates the complexities of a takeover attempt and the legal implications involved, particularly regarding anti-trust laws.
dcterms:title: Mobil-Marathon Case

dcterms:creator: A. Michel
I. Shaked
dcterms:description: The Brown Shoe & G.R. Kinney case serves as a precedent in evaluating anti-trust issues in mergers, highlighting market share concerns.
dcterms:title: Brown Shoe & G.R. Kinney Case

dcterms:creator: R.C. Ferrara
dcterms:description: The Pabst Company case examines the implications of mergers and acquisitions during the 1980s, focusing on strategies for attack and survival.
dcterms:title: Pabst Company Case
